alert.note: Alert for Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 5:14PM CDT until June 02 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Texas, including the following counties, Lubbock and Lynn. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 512 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing moderate to heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lubbock, Slaton, Wolfforth, Ransom Canyon, Woodrow, Downtown Lubbock, Texas Tech University, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Slide, Reese Center, Buffalo Springs and Lubbock Science Spectrum. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
